explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 and Class 8 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#3455 Cresol (solid))

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 559degC (ICSC, 2000)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available - melting point: 35degC (ICSC, 2000), test temperature: 140degC

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available. Corrosivity to metals remains uncertain, though classified as "corrosive substances" (as the classification based on UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods includes "skin corrosivity") (UN#3455 Cresol (solid)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 207mg/kg (EHC 168 (1995)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the animal LD50 (dermal route) value of 300mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 750mg/kg and 300 mg/kg (EHC 168 (1995)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "irreversible destruction of skin tissues" (EHC 168 (1995)) from the rabbit skin irritation test, although the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye and skin irritation tests: "Severe irritation to the conjunctiva, cornea and iris is observed, which does not recover within 72 hours" (SIDS (2005)) and "Irreversible damage to the skin is observed" (EHC 168 (1995)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (DFGOT Vol.14 (2000)) and data on human health effects (SIDS (2005)) - both negative.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the negative resulrts in multi-generation mutagenicity (dominant lethal test), the absence of the data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, described in CERI Hazard Data 97-9 (iii) (1998), ATSDR (1992), SIDS (2005) and NTP DB (Access on October 2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category C by EPA (1991).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the description in MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 1 (2002), CERI Hazard Data 97-9 (iii) (1998) and ATSDR (1992): The results of reproductive toxicity tests suggest no adverse effects on reproduction function and ability. It should be noted, however, some teratogenicity studies reported on minor skeletal defects in rat embryos.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system, kidney), Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (central nervous system, kidney) May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "a decrease in locomotor activity, tremor, lacrimation, lacrimation, dyspnea, cyanosis, hemorrhagic rhinitis, convulsions, physical collapse, irritation to the nasal cavity, nervous muscular excitement, hematuria" (SIDS (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system, central nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "hyperplasia of nasal respiratory epithelium, squamous epitheliummetaplasia" (CERI Hazard Data 97-9 (iii) (1998)), "salivation, tremor, abdominal contamination from urine, a decrease in locomotor activity, tachypnea, labored breathing, clonic spasm, hyperreaction" (SIDS (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours LC50=1.4mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (EHC168 (1995) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (40 days decomposition (the OECD testing guideline 301C): 80-95% (SIDS, 2005)), and bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=1.94(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Not classified.
